intro: Thalictrum tacabicum, commonly known as the alpine meadow rue, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Asia. It is a member of the Ranunculaceae family and is characterized by its delicate, fern-like leaves and clusters of small, yellowish-green flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments at high altitudes. It has a creeping rhizome and produces numerous stamens, which are a notable feature of its floral structure. Thalictrum tacabicum is valued for its ornamental appeal and ecological role in alpine ecosystems.
